      • readExcel

        public static jxl.Cell[] readExcel(String sheetName,
                                   String uniqueValue)
                            throws jxl.read.biff.BiffException,
                                   IOException,
                                   Exception
        Reads a default excel file(located at: ./testdata/webTestData.xls) and returns the entire record for the uniqueValue specified from the sheetName specified.
        Parameters:
        sheetName - the sheet name from which you wish to read and return a record
        uniqueValue - the unique value for which the entire record(row) will be returned
        Returns:
        the cell[] array for the entire record(row)
        Throws:
        jxl.read.biff.BiffException - the biff exception
        IOException - Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.
        Exception - the exception

        keyWord - the key word(next cell) from which you wish to get the data
        Returns:
        the array list
        Throws:

                                                          String sheetName,
                                                          String keyWord)
                                                   throws jxl.read.biff.BiffException,
                                                          IOException,
                                                          Exception
        Read excel(located at custom location - filePath passed as parameter) column from keyword onwards until it finds the empty cell.
        Parameters:
        fileNameWithPath - the file name with path. Ex:"./testdata/linkCheckerInputData.xls"
        sheetName - the sheet name
        keyWord - the key word(next cell) from which you wish to get the data
        Returns:
        the array list
        Throws:

      • readExcelColumnFromStart

        public static ArrayList readExcelColumnFromStart(String sheetName,
                                                 int coulumnNo)
                                          throws jxl.read.biff.BiffException,
                                                 IOException,
                                                 Exception
        Read excel(located at default location:"./testdata/webTestData.xls") column from start, until it finds the empty cell.
        Parameters:
        sheetName - the sheet name from which column data is to be extracted
        coulumnNo - the coulumn no. Index starts from 0 for Column A.
        Returns:
        the array list which contains data of entire column until empty cell is found
        Throws:
        jxl.read.biff.BiffException - the biff exception
        IOException - Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.
        Exception - the exception

      • readExcelColumnFromStart

        public static ArrayList readExcelColumnFromStart(String fileNameWithPath,
                                                 String sheetName,
                                                 int coulumnNo)
                                          throws jxl.read.biff.BiffException,
                                                 IOException,
                                                 Exception
        Read excel(located at custom location - fileNameWithPath passed as parameter) column from start, until it finds the empty cell.
        Parameters:
        fileNameWithPath - the file name with path. Ex:"./testdata/linkCheckerInputData.xls"
        sheetName - the sheet name from which column data is to be extracted
        coulumnNo - the coulumn no. Index starts from 0 for Column A.
        Returns:
        the array list which contains data of entire column until empty cell is found
        Throws:
        jxl.read.biff.BiffException - the biff exception
        IOException - Signals that an I/O exception has occurred.
        Exception - the exception

      • uploadAttachmentForWindowsViaJavaRobotLib

        public static void uploadAttachmentForWindowsViaJavaRobotLib(String filePathInProject)
                                                      throws Exception
        Upload attachment via java robot library for windows operating system. Sometimes Selenium API ".sendKeys("path")" doesn't work to upload a file. Hence we can use this API to paste the file path in a text box and then upload the file.
        Parameters:
        filePathInProject - the file path in project. Ex: "\\testdata\\webTestData.xls"
        Throws:
        Exception
